SENT.plain: Aplastic anemia is a rare heterogeneous disorder of hematopoietic stem cells causing pancytopenia and marrow hypoplasia with the depletion of all types of blood cells
This results in anemia, neutropenia and thrombocytopenia, which pose a challenge to both surgical and anesthetic management of such cases
We report a child with aplastic anemia who sustained traumatic ulcer on the arm and underwent split-thickness skin grafting under general anesthesia
There are only two case reports on anesthetic considerations in aplastic anemia patients in the literature
The anesthetic management is challenging because of the rarity of the disease, associated pancytopenia and immunosuppression
